request.description:
This is the endpoint to verify the otp sent.
NB: you should watch only the http response for this request such that, if you have 200 then you can access the data in the body else it shoudl return an error...

either video or audio( in string format)

response.name: Call EMR - Error

urlencoded.description: this refers to the emr category ID that can be fetched from the "Fetch EMR Categories" endpoint
either video or audio( in string format)

response.body:
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": {
        "user_id": "The user_id field is required.",
        "user_lat": "The user_lat field is required.",
        "user_long": "The user_long field is required.",
        "user_address": "The user_address field is required.",
        "emr_id": "The emr_id field is required.",
        "emr_lat": "The emr_lat field is required.",
        "emr_long": "The emr_long field is required.",
        "emr_address": "The emr_address field is required.",
        "category": "The category field is required.",
        "type": "The type field is required."
    },
    "data": []
}

we will use a default OTP of 2020 since we cannot use an SMTP service because we don't have a valid domain name yet
